title.narrative: Hadin Kan Mu Karfin Mu (Our Unity, Our Strength): Reinforcing the resilience and reintegration of conflict affected women and children and promoting community peacebuilding in North East Nigeria

description.narrative: Output 1: Women and adolescent girls benefit and are empowered from income generating activities (IGA) and saving and loans schemes through well assessed and marketable skills Output 2: Social exclusion of women and girls affected by sexual violence and children associated with armed groups is reduced and successful reintegration increased Output 3: Women, girls and children GBV survivors are provided with timely, confidential and comprehensive case management Output 4: Training is provided in relevant technical areas to reinforce team and a Monitoring, Evaluation and Learning framework is established, to ensure effective implementation and adaptation

Reconciliation and reintegration are long-term processes and it is important to consolidate and scale up the projectâ€™s impact in the next phase. To do so, International Alert will maintain its fundamental approach while drawing on lessons learned: -A continuous capacity-building and mentoring curriculum is necessary for community and religious leaders to reinforce their ability to play their role as positive agents of peace, including in facilitating dialogue and mediating local conflicts.
-Dedicated resources must be provided to ensure a robust case management and referral system for project participants needing additional support beyond the projectâ€™s direct means.
-Women and girls returnees have a particularly high level of economic vulnerability, which is an obstacle to acceptance by their families. Accompanying social reintegration efforts with financial empowerment will strongly reduce their vulnerability. This must be balanced with support to other vulnerable women in host communities to reinforce a spirit of solidarity and reduce conflict potential.
-There is an opportunity and necessity to engage children more actively and directly in peacebuilding, particularly those who were held in captivity and have experienced traumatic violence.
-There is an opportunity to engage communities on other emergent issues in the reconciliation process, including community militias, the reintegration of male former combatants, and transitional justice.
The projectâ€™s overall goal is to reinforce the resilience and reintegration of conflict affected women and children and promote community peacebuilding.
